content.question: In Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides across a rough floor with initial speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The block slides a distance <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> before coming to rest. In Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, a block of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math>, made of the same material as the block in Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, slides across the same rough floor with the same initial speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The block slides a distance <math alttext="d sub2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> before coming to rest. How do <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> compare?

choices.label: <math alttext="d sub 1, is less than d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="d sub 1, equals d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="d sub 1, is greater than d sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
